author: Corinne Schmitt
title: Healthy Thanksgiving Recipes Your Friends Will Love
text:
Thanksgiving is the perfect time to gather around the table with loved ones and savor the flavors of the season. But enjoying a festive meal doesn’t have to mean sacrificing your health.
Whether you’re looking to lighten up classic favorites or add a fresh twist to your table, these healthy Thanksgiving recipes have you covered.
Healthy Turkey Tetrazzini
This cozy turkey tetrazzini turns Thanksgiving turkey into a light and creamy comforting dish. It’s a tasty way to offer a healthier main dish for your Thanksgiving feast.
Sugar-Free Low Carb Pumpkin Pie
With its velvety, spiced pumpkin filling, this no-bake, low carb pie offers all the warm, autumn flavors of Thanksgiving, without the sugar. Use this recipe for a guilt-free fall treat.
Butternut Squash and Kale Stuffing
Roasted butternut squash and tender kale come together in this wholesome, rustic stuffing. It’s a vibrant and fresh alternative to traditional bread-based stuffings.
Air Fryer Butternut Squash Fries
These golden butternut squash fries are crisp on the outside and sweetly soft inside. The air-fryer makes this an easy and light side dish that pairs perfectly with Thanksgiving flavors.
Healthier Stovetop Mac and Cheese
This creamy stovetop mac and cheese uses greek yogurt to cut back on calories without sacrificing any flavor. It’s a warm, satisfying dish without the heavy feeling that kids and adults will love in your Thanksgiving spread.
Sugar Snap Pea Casserole
A refreshing fall twist on a Thanksgiving classic, this casserole features crisp, vibrant sugar snap peas in a creamy sauce. A bright and light side for your holiday spread.
Healthy Mashed Potatoes
These mashed potatoes are fluffy and light, with Greek yogurt and broth giving them a creamy texture without the usual richness. These are a great way to make a classic Thanksgiving side without the extra calories.
Healthy Green Bean Casserole
A Thanksgiving staple with a healthier twist, this gluten-free green bean casserole uses green beans and a homemade mushroom sauce for a nutritious and delicious holiday side.
Roasted Carrots With A Ginger Yogurt Sauce And Pepitas
Sweet roasted carrots are drizzled with a tangy ginger yogurt sauce and sprinkled with crunchy pepitas in this recipe. This colorful side bursts with fall flavor and adds a colorful addition to your Thanksgiving feast.
Healthy Cranberry Sauce With Cider And Vanilla
This spiced cranberry sauce, with hints of cinnamon and vanilla perfectly captures the essence of fall. It’s a healthy, tangy, and sweet complement to any Thanksgiving feast.
Want More Family-Friendly Recipes and Tips?
VISIT MY WEBSITE: Head over to Wondermom Wannabe for more easy family-friendly recipes and tips to make life easier. From meal plans to simple weeknight dinners, you’ll find everything you need to make mealtime stress-free!
FREE FAMILY DINNER IDEAS GUIDE: Get over 200 dinner ideas plus a free meal planning guide sent straight to your inbox!
Meet Corinne
Hi! I’m Corinne, a busy mom of four and the creator of Wondermom Wannabe. I’ve spent years helping moms like you simplify life with quick meal solutions and easy family tips. Wondermom Wannabe started as a place to share practical tips for home and family life, and it’s grown into a resource where you can find inspiration to make every day a little easier. [Learn more about me here].

author: NewsBreak Original
title: NFL Hall of Fame game between Texans, Bears cut short by extreme weather
text:
By Tim Weaver ,
1 hour ago
How do you make the longest preseason game of the year even longer? You call an extended delay due to extreme weather conditions with NFL officials seemingly unable to make a decision about whether or not to continue the game.
If that was on your bingo card you're in luck, because the Hall of Fame game between the Houston Texans and the Chicago Bears got stuck on pause with about three minutes left to go in the third quarter, which was about half an hour ago now.
The reason was severe thunderstorms in the area, including heavy rain and lightning. Here's a look from inside the press box.
After waiting a long time, the league has finally made a decision and called the rest of the game off, per Jonathan Alexander at the Houston Chronicle.
And so the Texans lose to the Bears by a score of 21-17. Chicago receiver Collin Johnson scored the winning touchdown early in the third quarter. Houston got strong performances from a few postiions, though - especially Davis Mills and Case Keenum at quarterback.
Expand All Read in NewsBreak

author: Jim Claborn is a retired history teacher and a published historian.
title: Back When | History | citizentribune.com
text:
Fighting Marine: Jack Shipley recounts two combat tours in Vietnam
There’s a friendly rivalry between the military branches and it’s obvious to anyone that Marines harbor a deep pride. Now 82, Jack Shipley still proudly maintains his Marine background.
After 2 Vietnam combat tours, the Purple Heart recipient liked the Marines well enough to build a career and retire as a Master Sergeant. A Marine Master Sergeant carries a lot of knowledge and experience which allows them a high level of authority. Troy Branch is a Sea Bee Vietnam vet with a spacious garage just right for his vet buddies to sit around and pass stories, and was where I met Jack Shipley.
Born in Jefferson City in 1941, Jack was the only child of Jack and June Brooks Shipley. Father Jack had served in the Navy during World War 2 and had returned home to support his family as a core driller. Jack recalled his boyhood Jefferson City days:
“My dad had worked at Cherokee Dam and was a cook downtown before he went into the Navy. In the Navy he was a cook on an LST that did island hopping with the Sea Bees during the war,” he told. “I remember VE (Victory in Europe) Day. I spent my early days running the streets of Jefferson City. My great- grandfather was born in 1875 and remembered seeing Buffalo Bill. Me and Mama would go to the Jefferson City train depot and go to Knoxville where we’d often go to the WNOX radio studio to hear such stars as Roy Acuff and Archie Campbell before taking the train back home. I started school at the old Jefferson Elementary School at Sawmill Hollow, then went to the old junior high where the swimming pool is today.
“When I was 13 we moved to Cedar City, Utah, where Dad had a job at exploratory drilling. Utah is a good place to raise a child. About a year and a half later we moved to Nogales, Arizona. It was in the ‘50s and there were a lot of old ranches around and I met a character who had fought the Apaches and who still wore 2 Colt pistols. He was bad news! They used to make Hollywood movies there and I got to watch them shoot scenes. A lot of my friends were extras in those movies and I saw Jean Simmons one time.
“We stayed in Nogales about a year, then moved to Clifton, Arizona, where they were mining copper. I started high school in Clifton and as a freshman joined the Explorer Scouts. At my initiation, they threw me into a river. Rivers there were only about 8 inches deep and I fractured my ankle and broke the tibia and fibia in my leg. During the summer I got to work on a 3,000 acre cattle ranch for $1.00 a day and later got a job as a dishwasher in a Mexican restaurant that paid 75 cents an hour, which was much better.
“We then moved to Bourbon, Missouri, where I spent my junior and senior years in high school and graduated in 1959. I had gone to the post office to join the Navy but no one was there. A Marine had come to our high school and I liked the uniform, so I joined the Marines. My basic training was at San Diego. It was serious but there was also some humor. You have to learn not to sweat the small stuff.”
Sixteen weeks of basic training was followed by an additional 4 weeks in Infantry training, where Jack was promoted to Private First Class. At the time, the basic Marine Infantry weapons were the heavy M-1s and BAR’s with the M-1s shifted to M-14s in 1961. Following his training, Jack was awarded an MOS as an engineer and was assigned to an amphibious assault fuel company, where some of their equipment included fuel buoys, Erie bulldozers and cranes. In 1960 he would be sent to Okinawa, Japan.
After reenlisting, he came home before being sent to Long Beach, California, where his assignment was working in the post brig. He told of the philosophy in handling the prisoners. “We gave them little responsibilities and tried to send them back better than when they came in.” Now a sergeant, Jack was sent to Vietnam in 1966. Arriving at Chu Lai, he would find that they were top heavy with sergeants, and was asked where in Vietnam he wanted to go.
Having a buddy already in Vietnam, Jack asked to be stationed near his friend and was sent to the First Battalion of the 7th Marines. There a Sergeant Major sent him to Charlie Company where the company First Sergeant sent him to lead a squad on PF Hill with the mission of backing up the unit. One of Jack’s duties was to lead his squad on patrols. On one mission he was hit by 3 bullets at one time, with one bullet hitting his rifle handguard,another on his helmet, and the third on his pack, which spun him around.
On one occasion, he would be 1 kilometer from Cambodia and would endure a month of rain in 1966. He would describe another mission: “Another time my squad was to be used as a blocking force where we had to take along a 400 pound recoilless rifle on a 3 day mission. The weapon was heavy and our small squad also had to carry 20 rounds of ammunition for that gun. On the third night, we were ambushed and had 4 men wounded. We shot the ammo into a hill to keep from having to carry it back. In April ’67 we turned our sector over to the Army it was where Lieutenant Calley got into that scrap. ”
Leaving Vietnam, Jack returned to Camp Pendleton where the Marines were putting together a replacement battalion which was in training until March 1968. Afterwards, he would be assigned to sea duty as the First Sergeant over 35 Marines on the USS Topeka with the duty of providing security over nuclear warheads. Sailing on to Florida, they had refresher training at Guantanamo Bay before heading to the Mediterranean for 7 months. After being based in Trieste, Italy, they would return across the North Atlantic to Boston, where their ship would be assigned to the scrap yard.
Returning to the Jacksonville Air Station, he would serve as a troop handler for 6 months before getting orders back to Vietnam. In July 1969 he would serve in L Company, 3rd Battalion, 3rd Marines with Captain Krulak as his company commander. Krulak who would later become the Marine Commandant. During his tour he would meet the then Lieutenant Oliver North, which he considered a “nice, calm officer”, and would later see Colonel North at reunions. .
“I was a Platoon Sergeant and we seen considerable combat and lost a lot of people”, he recounted. “We were set up in a finger area and stumbled upon the North Vietnamese. We lost half our patrol before a Staff Sergeant stopped their machine gun. We called in helicopters and aircraft and they retreated at midnight. A couple of months later they came back in and nearly wiped out a platoon. We lost 6 lieutenants, 4 of them in 3 months and I picked up a Bronze Star. One night 2 rounds came in on me, but they were both duds.
“After the 3rd Division pulled out I went to the First Division south of Danang in November. In March, we walked into an ambush and I was hit 24 times by a mine with 12 pieces below my belt and the other 12 above. They sent me to Japan and on to Bremerrton, Washington for 4 months in the Bremerton Naval Hospital. Afterwards, I was sent back to Camp Pendleton with my arm still in a cast to serve as an instructor in 1970 and 1971. In 1972 I was picked out for an education program and went to a junior college for 2 years where I picked up an associate degree in political science and was promoted to Gunnery Sergeant.
Then assigned back to Camp Pendleton Jack served as an advisor to Sea Bees Unit MCB3. “It was great duty”, he said. “We were the best in the fleet for 3 years and I made Master Sergeant. By that time I was wanting out and got out in December ’79 and bought a truck in 1980 that I drove until 1983”.
Having known Pat Newman “all my life and held her as a baby” the two have now been married for 40 years and live in Dandridge on Pat’s old homeplace. Using the GI Bill to go to vocational school, Jack built a 15 year career with TVA. Pat and Jack were avid elk hunters who made annual trips to New Mexico until 2018. He and Pat have daughters Debbie and Denise and 6 grandchilderen. Retiring in 2008, he tells that Pat is a quilter and that he is a qualified “quilter helper”
“Wars are planned,” he ended. “Just watch the uniforms and they’ll tell where the next war will be”.

author: PA News Agency
title: Farrier hails ‘incredible’ 2023 after horseshoes captivate millions on TikTok | Norwich Evening News
text: A farrier whose horseshoe videos have attracted celebrity endorsement and made him one of the UK’s most viewed TikTokers for a third year running has hailed 2023 as “incredible”. Sam Dracott, who smiths shoes for horses and treats infected hooves, appeared in the top 10 most-viewed TikTok videos in 2021 then was the UK’s number one most-viewed account of 2022 – and has now followed up the feat as the UK’s second-most viewed TikToker in 2023. The 34-year-old, from Weybridge, Surrey, boasts more than four million followers and more than 59.5 million likes – second only to Tool Tips which went viral for its staple creation – and said his success provides “huge recognition” for his often misunderstood job. “To be in the top 10 TikTok list once was incredible, twice was unbelievable and this third win three years in a row is just absolutely unreal,” the farrier told the PA news agency. “I can’t get over how the content continues to fascinate and inspire others. “It shows me huge recognition for everything we do and, that finally, it is becoming understood! “So many people have told me they are now considering a career becoming a farrier and that is something really special.” Mr Dracott’s videos, which have become a source of satisfaction for TikTok users, show how he changes horseshoes, removes debris, shaves down hooves and treats infections. His content even caught the attention of celebrities this year – including American singer Jason Derulo. “It’s been an incredible year… I got a message (from Jason Derulo) saying ‘I love your content, am I able to post it on my channel because I can’t stop watching it?’,” the TikToker said. “To have an international star tagging and seeing your videos, it’s a great feeling. It’s unbelievable.” Mr Dracott called his time working alongside broadcaster Alan Titchmarsh a career highlight and “a great experience” after he appeared on the gardener’s Love Your Weekend programme on ITV to showcase farriery. Mr Dracott posted his first video in April 2021 on the short-form app, which he said “exploded” after it was viewed by millions within four hours and earned him one million followers in one month. He was inspired to post footage of his day-to-day work after constantly being quizzed about his job but said it is rewarding to educate people about his profession. “It’s very rewarding,” he said. “When you’re in the equestrian world, you see it day in and day out so you don’t really think about it. “As soon as I posted the first video, it actually just blew up.” He added his job “sounds simple” but takes “years of practice” to master. “It’s an art that most people think has been lost, but it’s still there, still strong and there’s a lot more educational side to it – more than people think,” he said. “It’s a great feeling to educate people on that.” Mr Dracott’s main challenge as a content creator is debunking myths about the horses’ welfare as users often question if farriery hurts the animals. “A lot of people think horses don’t like having this or it hurts, but as farriers as our jobs, we’re increasing the horse’s working life and welfare, so we’re only there to help the animals,” he explained. He aims to use his platform to raise the profile of farriers in the UK to an international audience. “I’m trying to get people to realise that in the UK, farriers are training to such a high level compared to the rest of the world,” he said. “I’m trying to expose how highly qualified we are so it will be nice to do some international stuff.” The viral farrier described TikTok as a platform to help people “relieve a bit of stress” and urged creators to use the app for “good reasons”. He explained: “I think TikTok, used in the right way, is a fantastic way of educating and escaping reality. “Life’s quite stressful and it’s a nice way to escape and learn about how other people live and what they do. It’s exposing different angles and certain styles of living in, hopefully, a good way. “Keep trying to use the platform for good reasons rather than trying to expose it.”

author: John Trainor Las Vegas Review-journal En Español
title: Jugadores de UNLV usarán casco retro en su primer juego de local | UNLV | Deportes
text:
UNLV usará cascos especiales para el partido inaugural de fútbol americano en casa este sábado contra Utah Tech en el Allegiant Stadium.
Para conmemorar el 50 aniversario del equipo de 1974, los Rebels estrenarán cascos blancos con máscaras rojas y el logotipo “sunburst” de la universidad, que se usaba en los años 70.
Los Rebels terminaron la temporada regular invictos en 1974 y lograron un récord de 12 victorias bajo el mando del entrenador Ron Meyer. Avanzaron a las semifinales de la División II de la NCAA antes de perder contra Delaware.
Los miembros de ese equipo, que usaban cascos rojos lisos, serán reconocidos en el medio tiempo del partido del sábado. El equipo fue incluido en el Salón de la Fama de Atletismo de UNLV en 1988.
El partido contra el oponente de FCS, Utah Tech, comenzará a las 12 del mediodía.
Este es el tercer casco inspirado en el pasado que los Rebels usan bajo el mando del entrenador Barry Odom en su segundo año. La temporada pasada, los cascos de UNLV para su partido inaugural presentaron la fuente de “Rebels” de mediados de los años 80, cuando Randall Cunningham fue la estrella como mariscal de campo.
Cuando se enfrentaron a UTEP, los Rebels también usaron uniformes completamente blancos, con una calcomanía en el casco inspirada en el diseño usado de 1987 a 1989.

author: Javier del Pozo
title: Descubre el polvo activo de Bosque Verde que revoluciona la limpieza del baño con su eficacia efervescente
text:
Descubre el polvo activo de Bosque Verde que revoluciona la limpieza del baño con su eficacia efervescente
Excelente opción para quienes buscan un limpiador eficaz y fácil de usar sus inodoros.
[Características](#span-style-font-size-20px-strongcaracteristicasnbsp-strong-span)[Fácil de usar](#span-style-font-size-20px-strongfacil-de-usar-strong-span)[Beneficios para el usuario](#span-style-font-size-20px-strongbeneficios-para-el-usuario-strong-span)[Sostenibilidad](#span-style-font-size-20px-strongnbsp-sostenibilidad-strong-span)[Disponibilidad y precio](#span-style-font-size-20px-strongdisponibilidad-y-precio-strong-span)[Opiniones de los usuarios](#span-style-font-size-20px-strongopiniones-de-los-usuarios-strong-span)
Características
Una de las principales características del polvo activo es que es un polvo espumoso. Al entrar en contacto con el agua, el polvo se activa y produce espuma, que ayuda a descomponer la suciedad y la acumulación de cal en el inodoro. Esta acción espumante no sólo facilita la limpieza, sino que también tiene un efecto bactericida, eliminando los gérmenes y bacterias que puedan estar presentes en las superficies mojadas.
Fácil de usar
Basta con verter el contenido de la bolsita en el inodoro y dejar actuar unos minutos. Durante este tiempo, la espuma penetra en la suciedad y los depósitos, facilitando la limpieza con un cepillo. Después de dejarlo reposar, basta con cepillar y aclarar con agua para mantener el inodoro limpio y fresco.
Beneficios para el usuario
Una de las mejores ventajas es que elimina las manchas difíciles y los depósitos calcáreos sin necesidad de frotar intensamente. Esto lo hace ideal para quienes buscan una solución eficaz y sencilla para mantener limpios los inodoros. Su uso regular también puede prevenir la acumulación de cal, ahorrando tiempo y esfuerzo de limpieza a largo plazo.
El aroma del producto es otro aspecto positivo. Muchos usuarios aprecian que, además de limpiar, este producto deja un aroma fresco y ayuda a eliminar los malos olores del inodoro. Esto hace que el ambiente del inodoro sea más agradable.
Sostenibilidad
Bosque Verde también es respetuoso con el medio ambiente, y aunque no todos los productos son completamente ecológicos, muchos contienen ingredientes que minimizan el impacto medioambiental. Además, son de un solo uso, por lo que sólo se utiliza la cantidad necesaria para cada limpieza, reduciendo así los residuos.
Disponibilidad y precio
El polvo activo Bosque Verde está disponible principalmente en supermercados como Mercadona. Su precio suele rondar los 1,90 euros por envase, lo que lo convierte en una opción asequible para muchos hogares. Su disponibilidad y asequibilidad lo han convertido en una opción popular entre los consumidores.
Opiniones de los usuarios
La mayoría de los usuarios han dejado comentarios positivos . Muchos de ellos destacan su eficacia para eliminar la suciedad y su agradable fragancia. Algunos usuarios también prefieren este producto a otros líquidos y geles por su facilidad de uso y eficacia.
Sin embargo, como ocurre con cualquier producto de limpieza, también hay opiniones encontradas. Algunos usuarios señalan que, aunque el producto es eficaz para la limpieza habitual, puede no ser suficiente para las manchas muy resistentes o las manchas calcáreas extremas que se han acumulado con el tiempo. En estos casos, puede ser necesario un tratamiento más intensivo o varios usos repetidos.

author: Bleichmar Fonti & Auld
title: EVLV STOCK NEWS: Evolv Technologies Stock Plummeted 40% -
text:
NEW YORK, Nov. 22, 2024 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Leading securities law firm Bleichmar Fonti & Auld LLP announces that it has filed a lawsuit against Evolv Technologies Holdings, Inc. (NASDAQ: EVLV) and certain of the Company’s current and former senior executives.
If you invested in Evolv, you are encouraged to obtain additional information by visiting https://www.bfalaw.com/cases-investigations/evolv-technologies-holdings-inc .
Investors have until December 31, 2024 to ask the Court to be appointed to lead the case. The complaint asserts claims under Sections 10(b) and 20(a) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 on behalf of investors in Evolv’s securities. The case is pending in the U.S. District Court for the District of Massachusetts and is captioned Buchan v. Evolv Technologies Holdings, Inc. , No. 1:24-cv-12768. A copy of the lawsuit can be found here: https://www.bfalaw.com/siteFiles/Cases/EvolvFiledComplaint.pdf
What is the Lawsuit About?
Evolv is a security technology company that utilizes AI-based screening designed to help create safer experiences. The complaint alleges that Evolv’s financial statements prepared for the periods between the second quarter of 2022 and the second quarter of 2024 contained material misstatements relating to Evolv’s revenue recognition and other reported metrics that are a function of revenue.
On October 25, 2024, Evolv announced that the Company’s financial statements issued between the second quarter of 2022 and the second quarter of 2024 should not be relied upon due to material misstatements impacting revenue recognition and other previously reported metrics that are a function of revenue. The Company revealed that certain sales, including sales to one of its largest channel partners, were subject to extra-contractual terms and conditions not shared with the Company’s accounting personnel and that certain Company personnel engaged in misconduct in connection with those transactions. The Company also announced that it has self-reported these issues to the Division of Enforcement of the Securities and Exchange Commission and was delaying filing its upcoming quarterly report for the third quarter of 2024. On this news, the price of Evolv stock declined roughly 40%, from $4.10 per share on October 24, 2024, to $2.47 per share on October 25, 2024.
Then, on October 31, 2024, Evolv announced the termination of the Company’s CEO, Peter George, effective immediately. The Company announced that Michael Ellenbogen, Evolv’s Chief Innovation Officer will serve in an interim role until a successor is appointed. On this news, the price of Evolv stock declined roughly 8%, from $2.34 per share on October 30, 2024, to $2.15 per share on October 31, 2024.
Click here for more information: https://www.bfalaw.com/cases-investigations/evolv-technologies-holdings-inc .
What Can You Do?
If you invested in Evolv you may have legal options and are encouraged to submit your information to the firm. All representation is on a contingency fee basis, there is no cost to you. Shareholders are not responsible for any court costs or expenses of litigation. The firm will seek court approval for any potential fees and expenses.
Submit your information by visiting:
https://www.bfalaw.com/cases-investigations/evolv-technologies-holdings-inc
Or contact:
Ross Shikowitz
ross@bfalaw.com
212-789-3619
Why Bleichmar Fonti & Auld LLP?
Bleichmar Fonti & Auld LLP is a leading international law firm representing plaintiffs in securities class actions and shareholder litigation. It was named among the Top 5 plaintiff law firms by ISS SCAS in 2023 and its attorneys have been named Titans of the Plaintiffs’ Bar by Law360 and SuperLawyers by Thompson Reuters. Among its recent notable successes, BFA recovered over $900 million in value from Tesla, Inc.’s Board of Directors (pending court approval), as well as $420 million from Teva Pharmaceutical Ind. Ltd.
For more information about BFA and its attorneys, please visit https://www.bfalaw.com .
https://www.bfalaw.com/cases-investigations/evolv-technologies-holdings-inc

author: Izabelle Lopes
title: BBB25: Gracyanne Barbosa conta que ganhou muitos ovos na Xepa e ainda não comeu
text:
Manter a dieta a base de ovos não está sendo um desafio para Gracyanne Barbosa no BBB, mesmo durante a Xepa. Durante uma conversa com sua irmã mais nova, Giovanna Jacobina, nessa quinta-feira (23) ela admitiu que ganhou uma grande quantidade de ovos de outros participantes na Xepa, mas esses estão sobrando pois ela não comeu todos até o momento.
Ovos de sobra
Gracyanne Barbosa, de 41 anos de idade, já mantém há bastante tempo uma dieta muito específica, onde ela come, diariamente, uma grande quantidade de ovos. No início do reality, alguns telespectadores chegaram a se perguntar se ela conseguiria manter essa rotina durante o programa e como reagiria em certas situações. Nessa quinta-feira, durante uma conversa com sua irmã, Giovanna, a modelo e fisiculturista admitiu que ganhou diversos ovos de outros participantes.
"Eu ganhei tantos e não comi. Realmente as pessoas não comeram. O Edi, vários dias, não comeu. Devia ter comido as coisas" contou ela durante a conversa com sua irmã.
Foi criado até mesmo um ''ovometro'' no programa para acompanhar o consumo de ovos diário da participante.
Gracyanne Barbosa (Vídeo: reprodução/Instagram/@graoficial)
Dieta de Gracyanne Barbosa
Já há bastante tempo, Gracyanne Barbosa conta que, para manter a forma, sua dieta consiste em comer diariamente uma quantidade de 40 ovos, sendo 30 claras e 10 ovos inteiros.
Seguindo essa dieta, ela mantém as proteínas e a massa corporal.
No entanto, meses antes de o programa ir ao ar, ela já estava passando por um acompanhamento com nutricionistas para traçar um plano para não prejudicar sua dieta durante o BBB25 e conseguir manter a alimentação, estando na Xepa ou não.
Foto destaque: Gracyanne Barbosa no BBB25 (Reprodução/@graoficial/X)

title: Jusqu’à 20 ou 30 centimètres de neige | L'hiver n'a pas dit son dernier mot! — 98.5 Montréal
text: Malgré l’arrivée du printemps, le froid s’installera pour quelques jours au Québec, alors que certaines régions du Québec vont recevoir jusqu'à 20 centimètres de neige ce week-end. Écoutez le météorologue chez Environnement Canada, Simon Legault, aborder avec Paul Arcand le soubresaut de l'hiver ce week-end, alors que le mercure sera à la hausse au cours de la semaine prochaine. «Ne rangez pas tout de suite toutes vos pelles et ne changez pas les pneus nécessairement en fin de semaine, mais on attend quand même en fin de semaine, samedi à Montréal, peut-être jusqu'à cinq centimètres, mais l'Estrie pourrait recevoir une quinzaine, peut-être même une vingtaine de centimètres en fin de semaine et de la neige assez légère. Donc les amateurs de ski, qui n'ont pas complètement fini la saison, vont pouvoir en profiter, mais c'est peut-être la dernière fois qu'on aura ça.» On aborde aussi les quantités de neige importantes - jusqu'à 40 centimètres par endroit - qui sont tombées sur les régions de la Gaspésie, du Bas-Saint-Laurent et de Chaudière-Appalaches.
